700907f-a.title: Bronx: Kingsbridge Road (Ea - Briggs Avenue
700907f-a.text:
Intersection of E. Eingsbridge Road (left)and Briggs Avenue,
looking northward.
May 4, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
700907f-a.folder: Kingsbridge Road (Ea & Briggs Avenue, Bronx, NY

701634f-c.title: Bronx: Kingsbridge Road (Ea - Briggs Avenue
701634f-c.text:
Poe Park (Bronx): The Edgar Allan Poe Cottage,
in which the famous poet lived from 1846 to 1849 and
wrote his pd6es ''Annabel Lee,' ''Ulalume,'' and ''Eureka.''
Here,too, hik wife Virginia died. The cottage was originally
located at 257 E. Kingsbridge Road, east side, between
Briggs Avenue and E. 194th Street, and was transferred to
the north end of the park in 1913. The photograph shows
the cottage at its original location.
1891
Gift of Randall Comfort
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE
(2 and 3)
The cottage within the park, years later.
May 4, 1938
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
701634f-c.folder: Kingsbridge Road (Ea & Briggs Avenue, Bronx, NY
